byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow, Eric Schmitt from Washington and Safak Timur from Istanbul.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO, SABRINA TAVERNISE and CEYLAN YEGINSU

abstract: Details about the victims of Istanbul airport attack have begun to trickle out; death toll from attack has risen to 41, and at least 23 victims were Turkish nationals; makeup of victims reflects Istanbul's cosmopolitan and international nature.

headline.print_headline: Aching for Victims, City Shaken Anew  Gropes for Answers
headline.main: Victims in Istanbul Airport Attack Reflect City’s International Character

snippet: Hours after the bombings, a limited number of flights resumed and workers continued clearing debris and replacing shattered windows at the airport.
lead_paragraph: Hours after the bombings, a limited number of flights resumed and workers continued clearing debris and replacing shattered windows at the airport.
